caption.title: Reassortment of oncolytic influenza A viruses and wild-type influenza A viruses.
caption.p: Examples of reassortment of an armed oncolytic influenza virus attenuated by NS1 truncation during co-infection with wild-type influenza virus. a represents transgene expression from the NS1 reading frame. All reassortants carrying the transgene are attenuated. b represents transgene expression from the M segment. Some reassortants may carry both wild-type elements of the attenuation marker NS1 and a transgene, leading to unpredictable effects of the newly created virus. NS1 nonstructural 1 protein.
